title: Superlinear Returns
summary_en: This essay critically examines the concept of "superlinear returns," arguing that performance rewards in many domains (business, fame, knowledge, even benefit to humanity) are not linear but exponential, leading to disproportionate outcomes. The author identifies two primary drivers: exponential growth (e.g., startups, learning) and thresholds (winner-take-all scenarios). A compelling insight is how these two drivers often intertwine, creating powerful compounding effects. The essay challenges conventional wisdom, particularly the "you get what you put in" adage, and explores how this phenomenon shapes fields from science to startups. It also provocatively links superlinear returns to increased inequality and emphasizes the diminishing role of traditional organizations, advocating for curiosity, risk-taking, and independent thought as pathways to leverage this new reality. The piece offers a powerful framework for understanding success in an increasingly non-linear world.
summary_zh: 这篇文章深入探讨了“超线性回报”这一引人深思的概念，它揭示了在许多领域中，努力与回报并非简单的线性关系，而是呈现出指数级增长或阈值效应。我特别认同作者提出的，这种现象并非资本主义的缺陷，而是世界的内在特征。它让我反思，在追求卓越的道路上，仅仅付出是不够的，更要懂得如何识别并驾驭那些能带来非凡成果的“浪潮”。文章对好奇心和独立思考的强调，也让我看到了在高度不确定的未来中，个体如何通过持续学习和突破性创新，实现真正的价值跃迁。
best_quote_en: You can't understand the world without understanding the concept of superlinear returns. And if you're ambitious you definitely should, because this will be the wave you surf on.
best_quote_zh: 离开了对超线性回报概念的理解，你就无法理解这个世界。如果你雄心勃勃，那更应该理解它，因为这将是你乘风破浪的浪潮。

title: [via bsky, found paper] "AI Consciousness: A Centrist Manifesto"
summary_en: This piece, despite its brevity, points to a fascinating philosophical debate at the intersection of artificial intelligence and consciousness. The very existence of a 'centrist manifesto' suggests a burgeoning field grappling with extreme viewpoints, from outright dismissal of AI consciousness to radical claims of its imminent arrival. It compels us to consider the evolving definition of consciousness itself and whether our current frameworks are adequate to assess non-biological entities. The article's link-post format, while minimalist, effectively directs readers to a deeper academic discussion, highlighting the intellectual ferment surrounding this complex and profoundly important topic. It’s a compelling signal of how quickly AI is pushing the boundaries of our understanding of intelligence and sentience.
summary_zh: 这篇短文，虽仅是链接，却指向了人工智能与意识交叉的深刻哲学辩论。它暗示着一个新兴领域正努力平衡极端观点，从彻底否认AI意识，到激进地宣称其即将来临。这让我不禁思考，我们对意识的定义是否需要重新审视，以及现有框架能否适用于非生物实体。这种极简的链接形式，却能有效地引导读者深入学术讨论，彰显了围绕这一复杂而重要议题的智力激荡。它清晰地表明，AI正在以前所未有的速度拓展我们对智能与感知的理解边界。
best_quote_zh: 这是一个指向 https://philpapers.org/archive/BIRACA-4.pdf 的链接帖。

title: What Ghislaine Maxwell Told the Justice Department
title_zh: 吉斯莱恩·麦克斯韦尔对司法部说了些什么
summary_en: This article critically dissects the unusual interview between Ghislaine Maxwell and Deputy Attorney General Todd Blanche, revealing it as a politically motivated damage-control operation rather than a genuine legal inquiry. The author skillfully highlights the disturbing lack of remorse from Maxwell regarding her heinous crimes and Blanche's complicity in allowing her to airbrush her past, particularly concerning Donald Trump's association with Jeffrey Epstein. The piece astutely observes that both Maxwell and Blanche shared a common goal: to exonerate Trump. It exposes the selective questioning, where inquiries about Democratic figures like Bill Clinton yielded no useful information, while Maxwell was allowed to lavish praise on Trump and vouch for his conduct. This deep dive into the interview's transcript offers a chilling look at how power dynamics can manipulate legal processes and distort truth, underscoring the profound disservice to victims and the public's right to unvarnished facts.
summary_zh: 读完这篇对麦克斯韦尔与司法部访谈的分析，我感到一种深刻的寒意。这哪里是法律问询，分明是一场精心策划的政治公关秀。麦克斯韦尔的无耻谎言和毫无悔意令人发指，而副总检察长布兰奇的顺从更是让人心寒。他们共同的目标竟然是为特朗普洗白，这完全背离了司法公正的原则。这种权力对真相的扭曲，不仅是对受害者的二次伤害，更是对公众信任的巨大侵蚀。我开始思考，当司法被政治裹挟，我们还能相信什么？
best_quote_en: Interrogator and witness shared the same goal—they were both there to make Trump happy—and their exchange reflected this arrangement.
best_quote_zh: 审讯者和证人有着共同的目标——他们都在那里取悦特朗普——他们的交流反映了这种安排。

title: Wisereads Vol. 105 — Steal Like an Artist by Austin Kleon, everything Kevin Kelly knows about self-publishing, and more
title_zh: Wisereads 第105期 — 奥斯汀·克莱恩的《像艺术家一样偷窃》，凯文·凯利关于自出版的一切，以及更多
summary_en: This curated digest, Wisereads Vol. 105, transcends a mere collection of links; it’s a masterclass in cross-disciplinary learning and creative application. I find particular intellectual stimulation in the diverse insights presented, from Austin Kleon's liberating philosophy on creative inspiration to Kevin Kelly's pragmatic wisdom on self-publishing. The inclusion of technical deep-dives like LLM limitations and system design principles, alongside reflections on teaching math and drawing, highlights a profound commitment to actionable knowledge. It elegantly demonstrates how seemingly disparate fields often converge on universal truths about learning, creation, and problem-solving. This compilation is not just informative; it's genuinely inspiring, urging readers to embrace iterative improvement and draw connections across domains.
summary_zh: 这份精选文摘，Wisereads 第105期，远不止是链接的集合，它更像是一堂跨学科学习与实践的启蒙课。奥斯汀·克莱恩关于创意灵感的解放性哲学，与凯文·凯利务实的自出版智慧并置，令人深思。从LLM局限性到系统设计原则，再到数学教学和绘画心得，这种多元视角的呈现，深刻揭示了知识的实用性与普适性。它巧妙地证明了看似独立的领域，实则在学习、创造与解决问题方面共享着共通的真理。这本合集不仅提供了信息，更激发了读者拥抱迭代改进、融会贯通的求知欲，令人受益匪浅。
best_quote_en: What a good artist understands is that nothing comes from nowhere... If we're free from the burden of trying to be completely original, we can stop trying to make something out of nothing, and we can embrace influence instead of running away from it.
best_quote_zh: 一个好的艺术家明白，没有什么东西是凭空而来的……如果我们摆脱了追求完全原创的负担，我们就可以停止试图从无到有地创造，转而拥抱影响，而不是逃避它。

title: Book Freak #191: Strength to Strength
title_zh: 书呆子 #191: 从优势到优势
summary_en: Arthur Brooks' "From Strength to Strength" offers a compelling counter-narrative to the conventional anxieties surrounding aging and professional decline. The book's core insight, that success and fulfillment in later life hinge on a deliberate shift from fluid to crystallized intelligence, resonates deeply. It's not merely about adapting, but strategically re-orienting one's definition of achievement from external metrics to internal wisdom and relational wealth. The practical advice on cultivating mentorship and meaningful connections is particularly actionable. This work challenges high-achievers to redefine their purpose, moving beyond a relentless pursuit of traditional success to embrace a more profound, community-driven impact. It feels like a timely intervention for anyone navigating mid-life transitions or seeking a more sustainable path to fulfillment.
summary_zh: 《从优势到优势》这本书颠覆了我们对衰老和成就的传统认知。它提出的从流体智力向晶体智力转变的观点，不仅是适应，更是对人生下半场价值的重新定义。我特别欣赏作者将成功与人际关系和教学相联系的洞察，这不仅仅是理论，更是实实在在的行动指南。这本书让我反思，真正的“成功”或许在于我们能给予和联结多少，而不仅仅是我们能获得多少。这对于任何处于人生转型期的个体，都是一剂精神上的良药。
best_quote_en: The secret to bearing my decline — no, enjoying it — is to be more conscious of the roots linking me to others. If I am connected to others in love, my decrease will be more than offset by increases to others — which is to say, increases to other facets of my true self.
best_quote_zh: 承受我的衰落——不，享受它——的秘诀在于更自觉地认识到我与他人相连的根源。如果我与他人在爱中相连，我的减少将被他人的增加所抵消——也就是说，被我真正自我的其他方面的增加所抵消。

title: How to Do Great Work
summary_en: This profound essay by Paul Graham delves into the essence of achieving 'great work,' moving beyond conventional wisdom and offering actionable insights applicable across disciplines. It emphasizes the critical role of curiosity as the primary driver, guiding individuals to identify their unique aptitudes and interests, explore knowledge frontiers, and discover overlooked problems. The piece challenges the traditional notion of planning, advocating for an iterative, 'staying upwind' approach where consistent effort on intrinsically exciting projects leads to emergent brilliance. Graham also highlights the importance of intellectual honesty, embracing unconventionality, and cultivating a robust morale, underscoring that true innovation often stems from questioning established models and being willing to appear foolish. It's a compelling read for anyone seeking to maximize their creative potential and make a significant impact.
summary_zh: 保罗·格雷厄姆这篇关于“如何做伟大的工作”的文章，字里行间充满了对创造与成就的深刻洞察。它颠覆了我们对成功的传统认知，强调好奇心是驱动一切的引擎，指引我们发现天赋、探索未知、甚至发现被忽视的问题。文章提出了一种迭代、随风而行的工作哲学，即通过持续投入于那些真正令人兴奋的项目，而非僵硬的规划，才能孕育出意想不到的卓越成果。它鼓励我们保持知识上的诚实，拥抱反常规，并像呵护生命般维护士气。读罢此文，我深感，真正的创新往往源于对既有模式的质疑和敢于“犯傻”的勇气，这不仅是一份指南，更是一种思维的启迪。
best_quote_en: Curiosity is the key to all four steps in doing great work: it will choose the field for you, get you to the frontier, cause you to notice the gaps in it, and drive you to explore them. The whole process is a kind of dance with curiosity.
best_quote_zh: 好奇心是完成伟大工作的四个步骤的关键：它会为你选择领域，带你走向前沿，让你注意到其中的空白，并驱使你去探索它们。整个过程就像是与好奇心共舞。

title: Female sexual attractiveness seems more egalitarian than people acknowledge
title_zh: 女性性吸引力似乎比人们承认的更趋于平等
summary_en: This thought-provoking essay challenges conventional notions of female sexual attractiveness, arguing that the perceived 'extraordinary' beauty of celebrities is often an illusion created by professional styling, makeup, and photography, rather than inherent genetic superiority. The author contends that the ceiling for female attractiveness is not as high as commonly believed, and that most women with average features can achieve a similar level of appeal with optimization. He delves into why men engage in 'attractiveness ranking' banter and speculates on why women might perpetuate the myth of extreme beauty disparities, touching upon social pressures, industry barriers, and psychological biases. It's a fascinating deconstruction of beauty standards, prompting a re-evaluation of what we perceive as 'attractive' versus what is manufactured for public consumption.
summary_zh: 这篇探讨女性性吸引力的文章令人深思。作者大胆提出，所谓“超凡脱俗”的美女，其魅力多半是专业打造的产物，而非天生丽质。他认为女性性吸引力的上限其实不高，多数普通女性通过优化也能达到同样水平。文章不仅剖析了男性为何热衷于“颜值排名”的玩笑，更深入探讨了女性可能持续这种“极端美貌差异”错觉的原因，触及社会压力、行业壁垒及心理偏差。读后不禁反思，我们所追捧的美，究竟是真实存在，还是被精心塑造的幻象？
best_quote_en: The ceiling for female sexual attractiveness is not very high. That's not to say there aren't contextual circumstances which can elevate attractiveness of an ordinary woman in that moment.
best_quote_zh: 女性性吸引力的上限并不是很高。这并不是说没有情境因素可以在那一刻提升一个普通女性的吸引力。

title: The New Orleans That Hurricane Katrina Revealed
title_zh: 飓风卡特里娜揭示的真正新奥尔良
summary_en: This profound analysis delves into how Hurricane Katrina exposed the deep-seated historical and systemic vulnerabilities of New Orleans, moving beyond the romanticized image of the city. Nicholas Lemann skillfully connects the disaster to a legacy of extraction economies, racial injustice, and political corruption dating back centuries, particularly to the sugar and slave trade. The article critically evaluates the city's unique susceptibility to systemic failure, arguing that Katrina was not merely a flood control issue but a symptom of a fundamentally fragile societal structure. It highlights the enduring challenges of population decline and the superficiality of post-Katrina recovery efforts, suggesting that while the city retains its cultural allure, its civic health remains precarious. The piece serves as a stark reminder of how historical foundations can dictate present-day realities, urging readers to look beyond superficial charm to understand deeper societal issues.
summary_zh: 这篇深度分析揭示了飓风卡特里娜如何撕下新奥尔良的浪漫面纱，暴露其根深蒂固的历史与系统性脆弱。作者巧妙地将灾难与几个世纪以来剥削经济、种族不公和政治腐败的遗留问题联系起来。读罢此文，我深感历史的沉重与惯性，一个城市的命运，往往深埋于其不愿面对的过去。文章提醒我们，即便有文化魅力，若无健康的社会肌理，亦是空中楼阁。它促使我反思，我们所见的美好，是否掩盖了更深层次的结构性问题。
best_quote_en: New Orleans is one of those declining cities where the local universities and hospitals are among the largest employers. It’s a place where you’re more likely to be asked who your people are than what you do for a living. It aims for your heart, not your head. By all means, visit. New Orleans needs you. But don’t deceive yourself about whether the city’s undeniable magic represents the level of its civic health.
best_quote_zh: 新奥尔良是那种衰落中的城市，当地的大学和医院是最大的雇主。在那里，你更有可能被问及你的家族背景，而非你的职业。它触动你的心，而非你的头脑。务必去参观。新奥尔良需要你。但不要自欺欺人，以为这座城市无可否认的魔力代表了其公民健康的水平。

title: Wisereads Vol. 104 — Gary Marcus on GPT-5, The Tao of Seneca with Tim Ferriss, and more
title_zh: Wisereads 第104期 — 加里·马库斯谈GPT-5，蒂姆·费里斯的《塞涅卡之道》及更多
summary_en: This Wisereads digest offers a curated collection of insights spanning AI, personal development, and classical philosophy. It critically examines the current state of AI, notably Gary Marcus's skeptical take on GPT-5's perceived shortcomings and the academic questioning of Chain-of-Thought reasoning. Beyond technology, the digest delves into practical wisdom for life and business, highlighting the importance of hiring committed individuals, the multifaceted nature of intelligence, and the enduring relevance of Stoic philosophy as exemplified by Seneca. The inclusion of diverse formats, from articles to YouTube videos and academic papers, provides a holistic perspective on contemporary challenges and timeless principles. It’s a compelling snapshot of intellectual discourse, encouraging readers to think deeply about both technological frontiers and personal mastery.
summary_zh: 本期Wisereads文摘内容丰富，横跨AI前沿、个人成长与古典哲学。加里·马库斯对GPT-5的批判性观点，以及学术界对“思维链”推理的质疑，都促使我们反思AI的真正能力与局限。同时，文章强调了招聘志同道合之人、理解智慧的多维度，以及塞涅卡斯多葛哲学对当下生活的永恒启示。这不仅是一次知识的汇集，更是一场关于如何应对时代挑战、实现自我精进的深思。它提醒我们，真正的智慧，既在于洞察科技趋势，也在于回归人性本源。
best_quote_en: There are more things, Lucilius, likely to frighten us than there are to crush us; we suffer more often in imagination than in reality.
best_quote_zh: 琉西利乌斯，我们更容易被想象中的恐惧吓倒，而非被现实所压垮；我们常常在想象中受苦，而非在现实中。

title: Leaving America/Osprey Carry-on/Residency for Paying Rent
title_zh: 离开美国/Osprey随身行李/预付租金获得居留权
summary_en: This content offers a collection of disparate but intriguing insights for those interested in travel, relocation, and practical logistics. From a podcast exploring the nuances of leaving America to a glowing review of a travel-ready suitcase, and a surprising revelation about obtaining Croatian residency by prepaying rent, it caters to a niche audience seeking unconventional wisdom. The inclusion of a new Amtrak route adds a domestic travel dimension. While seemingly disconnected, the underlying theme is about expanding horizons—whether geographically or through smarter travel choices. The value lies in the actionable tips and unique perspectives, especially the residency visa detail, which is genuinely novel. It's a quick, informative read for the curious nomad.
summary_zh: 这篇内容像一本迷你杂志，每一小节都抛出意外的实用信息。从探讨“离开美国”的播客，到对Osprey旅行箱的真诚推荐，再到令人拍案称奇的克罗地亚预付租金换居留权，以及美国国内新开的火车线路，每一点都触及了旅行者和潜在移居者的好奇心。它不是深奥的理论，而是生活智慧的碎片，尤其那个签证小窍门，简直是“黑科技”。读完感觉像打开了一扇扇小窗，看到了更多生活的可能性，非常适合那些追求“另辟蹊径”生活方式的人。
best_quote_en: “The ‘Croatian Apartment Visa,’ as it’s known, requires that you find residential property in the country and prepay rent for one year. If you can prove sufficient funds to support yourself, have health insurance covering your time in Croatia, and pass a criminal background check, you can stay in Croatia indefinitely, as long as you keep prepaying your annual rent.”
best_quote_zh: “‘克罗地亚公寓签证’，顾名思义，要求你在该国找到住所并预付一年租金。如果你能证明有足够资金支持自己，拥有在克罗地亚期间的健康保险，并通过犯罪背景调查，只要你持续预付年租金，就可以无限期留在克罗地亚。”
